trans-unit.source: Introduction to Storage | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Introduction to Storage | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: An overview of Microsoft Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: An overview of Microsoft Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: This article provides an extended introduction to Microsoft Azure Storage for developers, IT Pros, and business decision makers.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an extended introduction to Microsoft Azure Storage for developers, IT Pros, and business decision makers.

trans-unit.source: By reading it, you'll learn about:
trans-unit.target: By reading it, you'll learn about:

trans-unit.source: What Azure Storage is, and how you can take advantage of it in your cloud, mobile, server, and desktop applications
trans-unit.target: What Azure Storage is, and how you can take advantage of it in your cloud, mobile, server, and desktop applications

trans-unit.source: What kinds of data you can store with the Azure Storage services: Blob, Table, Queue, and File storage
trans-unit.target: What kinds of data you can store with the Azure Storage services: Blob, Table, Queue, and File storage

trans-unit.source: How access to your data in Azure Storage is managed
trans-unit.target: How access to your data in Azure Storage is managed

trans-unit.source: How your Azure Storage data is protected via redundancy and replication
trans-unit.target: How your Azure Storage data is protected via redundancy and replication

trans-unit.source: Where to go next to build your first Azure Storage application
trans-unit.target: Where to go next to build your first Azure Storage application

trans-unit.source: To get started with Azure Storage quickly, see <linkText>Get started with Azure Blobs, Tables, and Queues in 5 minutes</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: To get started with Azure Storage quickly, see <linkText>Get started with Azure Blobs, Tables, and Queues in 5 minutes</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: If you are looking for a quick high-level overview of Storage please take a look here or for a product specific overview see Azure Blobs; Azure Tables; Azure Queues, and Azure Files.
trans-unit.target: If you are looking for a quick high-level overview of Storage please take a look here or for a product specific overview see Azure Blobs; Azure Tables; Azure Queues, and Azure Files.

trans-unit.source: Cloud computing enables new scenarios for applications requiring scalable, durable, and highly available storage for their data – which is exactly why Microsoft developed Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Cloud computing enables new scenarios for applications requiring scalable, durable, and highly available storage for their data – which is exactly why Microsoft developed Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: In addition to making it possible for developers to build large-scale applications to support new scenarios, Azure Storage also provides the storage foundation for Azure Virtual Machines, a further testament to its robustness.
trans-unit.target: In addition to making it possible for developers to build large-scale applications to support new scenarios, Azure Storage also provides the storage foundation for Azure Virtual Machines, a further testament to its robustness.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage is massively scalable, so you can store and process hundreds of terabytes of data to support the big data scenarios required by scientific, financial analysis, and media applications.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage is massively scalable, so you can store and process hundreds of terabytes of data to support the big data scenarios required by scientific, financial analysis, and media applications.

trans-unit.source: Or you can store the small amounts of data required for a small business website.
trans-unit.target: Or you can store the small amounts of data required for a small business website.

trans-unit.source: Wherever your needs fall, you pay only for the data you’re storing.
trans-unit.target: Wherever your needs fall, you pay only for the data you’re storing.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage currently stores tens of trillions of unique customer objects, and handles millions of requests per second on average.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage currently stores tens of trillions of unique customer objects, and handles millions of requests per second on average.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage is elastic, so you can design applications for a large global audience, and scale those applications as needed - both in terms of the amount of data stored and the number of requests made against it.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage is elastic, so you can design applications for a large global audience, and scale those applications as needed - both in terms of the amount of data stored and the number of requests made against it.

trans-unit.source: You pay only for what you use, and only when you use it.
trans-unit.target: You pay only for what you use, and only when you use it.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage uses an auto-partitioning system that automatically load-balances your data based on traffic.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage uses an auto-partitioning system that automatically load-balances your data based on traffic.

trans-unit.source: This means that as the demands on your application grow, Azure Storage automatically allocates the appropriate resources to meet them.
trans-unit.target: This means that as the demands on your application grow, Azure Storage automatically allocates the appropriate resources to meet them.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage is accessible from anywhere in the world, from any type of application, whether it’s running in the cloud, on the desktop, on an on-premises server, or on a mobile or tablet device.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage is accessible from anywhere in the world, from any type of application, whether it’s running in the cloud, on the desktop, on an on-premises server, or on a mobile or tablet device.

trans-unit.source: You can use Azure Storage in mobile scenarios where the application stores a subset of data on the device and synchronizes it with a full set of data stored in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: You can use Azure Storage in mobile scenarios where the application stores a subset of data on the device and synchronizes it with a full set of data stored in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage supports clients using a diverse set of operating systems (including Windows and Linux) and a variety of programming languages (including .NET, Java, and C++) for convenient development.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage supports clients using a diverse set of operating systems (including Windows and Linux) and a variety of programming languages (including .NET, Java, and C++) for convenient development.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage also exposes data resources via simple REST APIs, which are available to any client capable of sending and receiving data via HTTP/HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage also exposes data resources via simple REST APIs, which are available to any client capable of sending and receiving data via HTTP/HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: Azure Premium Storage is now available in preview.
trans-unit.target: Azure Premium Storage is now available in preview.

trans-unit.source: Azure Premium Storage delivers high-performance, low-latency disk support for I/O intensive workloads running on Azure Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: Azure Premium Storage delivers high-performance, low-latency disk support for I/O intensive workloads running on Azure Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: With Azure Premium Storage, you can attach multiple persistent data disks to a virtual machine and configure them to meet your performance requirements.
trans-unit.target: With Azure Premium Storage, you can attach multiple persistent data disks to a virtual machine and configure them to meet your performance requirements.

trans-unit.source: Each data disk is backed by an SSD disk in Azure Premium Storage for maximum I/O performance.
trans-unit.target: Each data disk is backed by an SSD disk in Azure Premium Storage for maximum I/O performance.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Premium Storage: High-Performance Storage for Azure Virtual Machine Workloads</linkText><title></title> for more details.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Premium Storage: High-Performance Storage for Azure Virtual Machine Workloads</linkText><title></title> for more details.

trans-unit.source: An Azure storage account is a secure account that gives you access to services in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: An Azure storage account is a secure account that gives you access to services in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Your storage account provides the unique namespace for your storage resources.
trans-unit.target: Your storage account provides the unique namespace for your storage resources.

trans-unit.source: There are two types of storage accounts:
trans-unit.target: There are two types of storage accounts:

trans-unit.source: A standard storage account includes Blob, Table, Queue, and File storage.
trans-unit.target: A standard storage account includes Blob, Table, Queue, and File storage.

trans-unit.source: A premium storage account currently supports Azure Virtual Machine disks only.
trans-unit.target: A premium storage account currently supports Azure Virtual Machine disks only.

trans-unit.source: Azure Premium Storage is available by request via the <linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Azure Premium Storage is available by request via the <linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Before you can create a storage account, you must have an Azure subscription, which is a plan that gives you access to a variety of Azure services.
trans-unit.target: Before you can create a storage account, you must have an Azure subscription, which is a plan that gives you access to a variety of Azure services.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>You can create up to 100 uniquely named storage accounts with a single subscription.</linkText><title></title> See <linkText>Storage Pricing Details</linkText><title></title> for information on volume pricing.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>You can create up to 100 uniquely named storage accounts with a single subscription.</linkText><title></title> See <linkText>Storage Pricing Details</linkText><title></title> for information on volume pricing.

trans-unit.source: You can get started with Azure with a <linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can get started with Azure with a <linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Once you decide to purchase a plan, you can choose from a variety of <linkText>purchase options</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Once you decide to purchase a plan, you can choose from a variety of <linkText>purchase options</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you’re an <linkText>MSDN subscriber</linkText><title></title>, you get free monthly credits that you can use with Azure services, including Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: If you’re an <linkText>MSDN subscriber</linkText><title></title>, you get free monthly credits that you can use with Azure services, including Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: A standard storage account gives you access to Blob storage, Table storage, Queue storage, and File storage:
trans-unit.target: A standard storage account gives you access to Blob storage, Table storage, Queue storage, and File storage:

trans-unit.source: Blob storage stores file data.
trans-unit.target: Blob storage stores file data.

trans-unit.source: A blob can be any type of text or binary data, such as a document, media file, or application installer.
trans-unit.target: A blob can be any type of text or binary data, such as a document, media file, or application installer.

trans-unit.source: Table storage stores structured datasets.
trans-unit.target: Table storage stores structured datasets.

trans-unit.source: Table storage is a NoSQL key-attribute data store, which allows for rapid development and fast access to large quantities of data.
trans-unit.target: Table storage is a NoSQL key-attribute data store, which allows for rapid development and fast access to large quantities of data.

trans-unit.source: Queue storage provides reliable messaging for workflow processing and for communication between components of cloud services.
trans-unit.target: Queue storage provides reliable messaging for workflow processing and for communication between components of cloud services.

trans-unit.source: File storage (Preview) offers shared storage for legacy applications using the standard SMB 2.1 protocol.
trans-unit.target: File storage (Preview) offers shared storage for legacy applications using the standard SMB 2.1 protocol.

trans-unit.source: Azure virtual machines and cloud services can share file data across application components via mounted shares, and on-premise applications can access file data in a share via the File service REST API.
trans-unit.target: Azure virtual machines and cloud services can share file data across application components via mounted shares, and on-premise applications can access file data in a share via the File service REST API.

trans-unit.source: File storage is available by request via the <linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: File storage is available by request via the <linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Each standard storage account can contain up to 500 TB of combined blob, queue, table, and file data.
trans-unit.target: Each standard storage account can contain up to 500 TB of combined blob, queue, table, and file data.

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets</linkText><title></title> for details about standard storage account capacity.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets</linkText><title></title> for details about standard storage account capacity.

trans-unit.source: The image below shows the relationships between the Azure storage resources in a standard storage account:
trans-unit.target: The image below shows the relationships between the Azure storage resources in a standard storage account:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Storage Resources</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Storage Resources</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To learn how to create a standard storage account, see <linkText>Create, manage, or delete a storage account</linkText><title></title> for more details.
trans-unit.target: To learn how to create a standard storage account, see <linkText>Create, manage, or delete a storage account</linkText><title></title> for more details.

trans-unit.source: Azure Premium Storage currently supports Azure Virtual Machine disks only.
trans-unit.target: Azure Premium Storage currently supports Azure Virtual Machine disks only.

trans-unit.source: Azure Premium Storage is available by request through the <linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Azure Premium Storage is available by request through the <linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For an in-depth overview of Azure Premium Storage, see <linkText>Premium Storage: High-Performance Storage for Azure Virtual Machine Workloads</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For an in-depth overview of Azure Premium Storage, see <linkText>Premium Storage: High-Performance Storage for Azure Virtual Machine Workloads</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For users with large amounts of unstructured data to store in the cloud, Blob storage offers a cost-effective and scalable solution.
trans-unit.target: For users with large amounts of unstructured data to store in the cloud, Blob storage offers a cost-effective and scalable solution.

trans-unit.source: You can use Blob storage to store content such as:
trans-unit.target: You can use Blob storage to store content such as:

trans-unit.source: Documents
trans-unit.target: Documents

trans-unit.source: Social data such as photos, videos, music, and blogs
trans-unit.target: Social data such as photos, videos, music, and blogs

trans-unit.source: Backups of files, computers, databases, and devices
trans-unit.target: Backups of files, computers, databases, and devices

trans-unit.source: Images and text for web applications
trans-unit.target: Images and text for web applications

trans-unit.source: Configuration data for cloud applications
trans-unit.target: Configuration data for cloud applications

trans-unit.source: Big data, such as logs and other large datasets
trans-unit.target: Big data, such as logs and other large datasets

trans-unit.source: Every blob is organized into a container.
trans-unit.target: Every blob is organized into a container.

trans-unit.source: Containers also provide a useful way to assign security policies to groups of objects.
trans-unit.target: Containers also provide a useful way to assign security policies to groups of objects.

trans-unit.source: A storage account can contain any number of containers, and a container can contain any number of blobs, up to the 500 TB capacity limit of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: A storage account can contain any number of containers, and a container can contain any number of blobs, up to the 500 TB capacity limit of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Blob storage offers three types of blobs, block blobs, append blobs, and page blobs (disks).
trans-unit.target: Blob storage offers three types of blobs, block blobs, append blobs, and page blobs (disks).

trans-unit.source: Block blobs are optimized for streaming and storing cloud objects, and are a good choice for storing documents, media files, backups etc. Append blobs are similar to block blobs, but are optimized for append operations.
trans-unit.target: Block blobs are optimized for streaming and storing cloud objects, and are a good choice for storing documents, media files, backups etc. Append blobs are similar to block blobs, but are optimized for append operations.

trans-unit.source: An append blob can be updated only by adding a new block to the end.
trans-unit.target: An append blob can be updated only by adding a new block to the end.

trans-unit.source: Append blobs are a good choice for scenarios such as logging, where new data needs to be written only to the end of the blob.
trans-unit.target: Append blobs are a good choice for scenarios such as logging, where new data needs to be written only to the end of the blob.

trans-unit.source: Page blobs are optimized for representing IaaS disks and supporting random writes, and may be up to 1 TB in size.
trans-unit.target: Page blobs are optimized for representing IaaS disks and supporting random writes, and may be up to 1 TB in size.

trans-unit.source: An Azure virtual machine network attached IaaS disk is a VHD stored as a page blob.
trans-unit.target: An Azure virtual machine network attached IaaS disk is a VHD stored as a page blob.

trans-unit.source: For very large datasets where network constraints make uploading or downloading data to Blob storage over the wire unrealistic, you can ship a hard drive to Microsoft to import or export data directly from the data center using the <linkText>Azure Import/Export Service</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For very large datasets where network constraints make uploading or downloading data to Blob storage over the wire unrealistic, you can ship a hard drive to Microsoft to import or export data directly from the data center using the <linkText>Azure Import/Export Service</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also copy blob data within your storage account or across storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can also copy blob data within your storage account or across storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: Modern applications often demand data stores with greater scalability and flexibility than previous generations of software required.
trans-unit.target: Modern applications often demand data stores with greater scalability and flexibility than previous generations of software required.

trans-unit.source: Table storage offers highly available, massively scalable storage, so that your application can automatically scale to meet user demand.
trans-unit.target: Table storage offers highly available, massively scalable storage, so that your application can automatically scale to meet user demand.

trans-unit.source: Table storage is Microsoft’s NoSQL key/attribute store – it has a schemaless design, making it different from traditional relational databases.
trans-unit.target: Table storage is Microsoft’s NoSQL key/attribute store – it has a schemaless design, making it different from traditional relational databases.

trans-unit.source: With a schemaless data store, it's easy to adapt your data as the needs of your application evolve.
trans-unit.target: With a schemaless data store, it's easy to adapt your data as the needs of your application evolve.

trans-unit.source: Table storage is easy to use, so developers can create applications quickly.
trans-unit.target: Table storage is easy to use, so developers can create applications quickly.

trans-unit.source: Access to data is fast and cost-effective for all kinds of applications.
trans-unit.target: Access to data is fast and cost-effective for all kinds of applications.

trans-unit.source: Table storage is typically significantly lower in cost than traditional SQL for similar volumes of data.
trans-unit.target: Table storage is typically significantly lower in cost than traditional SQL for similar volumes of data.

trans-unit.source: Table storage is a key-attribute store, meaning that every value in a table is stored with a typed property name.
trans-unit.target: Table storage is a key-attribute store, meaning that every value in a table is stored with a typed property name.

trans-unit.source: The property name can be used for filtering and specifying selection criteria.
trans-unit.target: The property name can be used for filtering and specifying selection criteria.

trans-unit.source: A collection of properties and their values comprise an entity.
trans-unit.target: A collection of properties and their values comprise an entity.

trans-unit.source: Since Table storage is schemaless, two entities in the same table can contain different collections of properties, and those properties can be of different types.
trans-unit.target: Since Table storage is schemaless, two entities in the same table can contain different collections of properties, and those properties can be of different types.

trans-unit.source: You can use Table storage to store flexible datasets, such as user data for web applications, address books, device information, and any other type of metadata that your service requires.
trans-unit.target: You can use Table storage to store flexible datasets, such as user data for web applications, address books, device information, and any other type of metadata that your service requires.

trans-unit.source: You can store any number of entities in a table, and a storage account may contain any number of tables, up to the capacity limit of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: You can store any number of entities in a table, and a storage account may contain any number of tables, up to the capacity limit of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Like Blobs and Queues, developers can manage and access Table Storage using standard REST protocols, however Table Storage also supports a subset of the OData protocol, simplifying advanced querying capabilities and enabling both JSON and AtomPub (XML based) formats.
trans-unit.target: Like Blobs and Queues, developers can manage and access Table Storage using standard REST protocols, however Table Storage also supports a subset of the OData protocol, simplifying advanced querying capabilities and enabling both JSON and AtomPub (XML based) formats.

trans-unit.source: For today's Internet-based applications, NoSQL databases like Table storage offer a popular alternative to traditional relational databases.
trans-unit.target: For today's Internet-based applications, NoSQL databases like Table storage offer a popular alternative to traditional relational databases.

trans-unit.source: In designing applications for scale, application components are often decoupled, so that they can scale independently.
trans-unit.target: In designing applications for scale, application components are often decoupled, so that they can scale independently.

trans-unit.source: Queue storage provides a reliable messaging solution for asynchronous communication between application components, whether they are running in the cloud, on the desktop, on an on-premises server, or on a mobile device.
trans-unit.target: Queue storage provides a reliable messaging solution for asynchronous communication between application components, whether they are running in the cloud, on the desktop, on an on-premises server, or on a mobile device.

trans-unit.source: Queue storage also supports managing asynchronous tasks and building process workflows.
trans-unit.target: Queue storage also supports managing asynchronous tasks and building process workflows.

trans-unit.source: A storage account can contain any number of queues.
trans-unit.target: A storage account can contain any number of queues.

trans-unit.source: A queue can contain any number of messages, up to the capacity limit of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: A queue can contain any number of messages, up to the capacity limit of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Individual messages may be up to 64 KB in size.
trans-unit.target: Individual messages may be up to 64 KB in size.

trans-unit.source: Azure File storage offers cloud-based SMB 2.1 file shares, so that you can migrate legacy applications that rely on file shares to Azure quickly and without costly rewrites.
trans-unit.target: Azure File storage offers cloud-based SMB 2.1 file shares, so that you can migrate legacy applications that rely on file shares to Azure quickly and without costly rewrites.

trans-unit.source: With Azure File storage, applications running in Azure virtual machines or cloud services can mount a file share in the cloud, just as a desktop application mounts a typical SMB share.
trans-unit.target: With Azure File storage, applications running in Azure virtual machines or cloud services can mount a file share in the cloud, just as a desktop application mounts a typical SMB share.

trans-unit.source: Any number of application components can then mount and access the File storage share simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: Any number of application components can then mount and access the File storage share simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: Since a File storage share is a standard SMB 2.1 file share, applications running in Azure can access data in the share via file sytem I/O APIs.
trans-unit.target: Since a File storage share is a standard SMB 2.1 file share, applications running in Azure can access data in the share via file sytem I/O APIs.

trans-unit.source: Developers can therefore leverage their existing code and skills to migrate existing applications.
trans-unit.target: Developers can therefore leverage their existing code and skills to migrate existing applications.

trans-unit.source: IT Pros can use PowerShell cmdlets to create, mount, and manage File storage shares as part of the administration of Azure applications.
trans-unit.target: IT Pros can use PowerShell cmdlets to create, mount, and manage File storage shares as part of the administration of Azure applications.

trans-unit.source: Like the other Azure storage services, File storage exposes a REST API for accessing data in a share.
trans-unit.target: Like the other Azure storage services, File storage exposes a REST API for accessing data in a share.

trans-unit.source: On-premise applications can call the File storage REST API to access data in a file share.
trans-unit.target: On-premise applications can call the File storage REST API to access data in a file share.

trans-unit.source: This way, an enterprise can choose to migrate some legacy applications to Azure and continue running others from within their own organization.
trans-unit.target: This way, an enterprise can choose to migrate some legacy applications to Azure and continue running others from within their own organization.

trans-unit.source: Note that mounting a file share is only possible for applications running in Azure; an on-premise application may only access the file share via the REST API.
trans-unit.target: Note that mounting a file share is only possible for applications running in Azure; an on-premise application may only access the file share via the REST API.

trans-unit.source: Distributed applications can also use File storage to store and share useful application data and development and testing tools.
trans-unit.target: Distributed applications can also use File storage to store and share useful application data and development and testing tools.

trans-unit.source: For example, an application may store configuration files and diagnostic data such as logs, metrics, and crash dumps in a File storage share so that they are available to multiple virtual machines or roles.
trans-unit.target: For example, an application may store configuration files and diagnostic data such as logs, metrics, and crash dumps in a File storage share so that they are available to multiple virtual machines or roles.

trans-unit.source: Developers and administrators can store utilities that they need to build or manage an application in a File storage share that is available to all components, rather than installing them on every virtual machine or role instance.
trans-unit.target: Developers and administrators can store utilities that they need to build or manage an application in a File storage share that is available to all components, rather than installing them on every virtual machine or role instance.

trans-unit.source: By default, only the storage account owner can access resources in the storage account.
trans-unit.target: By default, only the storage account owner can access resources in the storage account.

trans-unit.source: For the security of your data, every request made against resources in your account must be authenticated.
trans-unit.target: For the security of your data, every request made against resources in your account must be authenticated.

trans-unit.source: Authentication relies on a Shared Key model.
trans-unit.target: Authentication relies on a Shared Key model.

trans-unit.source: Blobs can also be configured to support anonymous authentication.
trans-unit.target: Blobs can also be configured to support anonymous authentication.

trans-unit.source: Your storage account is assigned two private access keys on creation that are used for authentication.
trans-unit.target: Your storage account is assigned two private access keys on creation that are used for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Having two keys ensures that your application remains available when you regularly regenerate the keys as a common security key management practice.
trans-unit.target: Having two keys ensures that your application remains available when you regularly regenerate the keys as a common security key management practice.

trans-unit.source: If you do need to allow users controlled access to your storage resources, then you can create a <linkText>shared access signature</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you do need to allow users controlled access to your storage resources, then you can create a <linkText>shared access signature</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A shared access signature is a token that can be appended to a URL that enables delegated access to a container, blob, table, or queue.
trans-unit.target: A shared access signature is a token that can be appended to a URL that enables delegated access to a container, blob, table, or queue.

trans-unit.source: Anyone who possesses the token can access the resource it points to with the permissions it specifies, for the period of time that it is valid.
trans-unit.target: Anyone who possesses the token can access the resource it points to with the permissions it specifies, for the period of time that it is valid.

trans-unit.source: Note that Azure File storage does not currently support shared access signatures.
trans-unit.target: Note that Azure File storage does not currently support shared access signatures.

trans-unit.source: Finally, you can specify that a container and its blobs, or a specific blob, are available for public access.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you can specify that a container and its blobs, or a specific blob, are available for public access.

trans-unit.source: When you indicate that a container or blob is public, anyone can read it anonymously; no authentication is required.
trans-unit.target: When you indicate that a container or blob is public, anyone can read it anonymously; no authentication is required.

trans-unit.source: Public containers and blobs are useful for exposing resources such as media and documents that are hosted on websites.
trans-unit.target: Public containers and blobs are useful for exposing resources such as media and documents that are hosted on websites.

trans-unit.source: To decrease network latency for a global audience, you can cache blob data used by websites with the Azure CDN.
trans-unit.target: To decrease network latency for a global audience, you can cache blob data used by websites with the Azure CDN.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Manage Access to Azure Storage Resources</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Authentication for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><title></title> for more information on secure access to your storage account.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Manage Access to Azure Storage Resources</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Authentication for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><title></title> for more information on secure access to your storage account.

trans-unit.source: Customers are charged for Azure Storage based on four factors: the storage capacity used, the replication option selected, the number of requests made against the service, and data egress.
trans-unit.target: Customers are charged for Azure Storage based on four factors: the storage capacity used, the replication option selected, the number of requests made against the service, and data egress.

trans-unit.source: Storage capacity refers to how much of your storage account allotment you are using to store data.
trans-unit.target: Storage capacity refers to how much of your storage account allotment you are using to store data.

trans-unit.source: The cost of simply storing your data is determined by how much data you are storing, and how it is replicated.
trans-unit.target: The cost of simply storing your data is determined by how much data you are storing, and how it is replicated.

trans-unit.source: Every read and write operation against Azure Storage also makes a request against the service.
trans-unit.target: Every read and write operation against Azure Storage also makes a request against the service.

trans-unit.source: Data egress refers to data transferred out of a Microsoft Azure region.
trans-unit.target: Data egress refers to data transferred out of a Microsoft Azure region.

trans-unit.source: When the data in your storage account is accessed by an application that is not running in the same region, whether that application is a cloud service or some other type of application, then you are charged for data egress.
trans-unit.target: When the data in your storage account is accessed by an application that is not running in the same region, whether that application is a cloud service or some other type of application, then you are charged for data egress.

trans-unit.source: (For Microsoft Azure services, you can take steps to group your data and services in the same data centers to reduce or eliminate process and data egress charges.)
trans-unit.target: (For Microsoft Azure services, you can take steps to group your data and services in the same data centers to reduce or eliminate process and data egress charges.)

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>Storage Pricing Details</linkText><title></title> page provides detailed pricing information for storage capacity, replication, and transactions.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>Storage Pricing Details</linkText><title></title> page provides detailed pricing information for storage capacity, replication, and transactions.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>Data Transfers Pricing Details</linkText><title></title> provides detailed pricing information for data egress.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>Data Transfers Pricing Details</linkText><title></title> provides detailed pricing information for data egress.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <linkText>Azure Storage Pricing Calculator</linkText><title></title> to help estimate your costs.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <linkText>Azure Storage Pricing Calculator</linkText><title></title> to help estimate your costs.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage exposes storage resources via a <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title> that can be called by any language that can make HTTP/HTTPS requests.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage exposes storage resources via a <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title> that can be called by any language that can make HTTP/HTTPS requests.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, Azure Storage offers programming libraries for several popular languages.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, Azure Storage offers programming libraries for several popular languages.

trans-unit.source: These libraries simplify many aspects of working with Azure Storage by handling details such as synchronous and asynchronous invocation, batching of operations, exception management, automatic retries, operational behavior and so forth.
trans-unit.target: These libraries simplify many aspects of working with Azure Storage by handling details such as synchronous and asynchronous invocation, batching of operations, exception management, automatic retries, operational behavior and so forth.

trans-unit.source: Libraries are currently available for the following languages and platforms, with others in the pipeline:
trans-unit.target: Libraries are currently available for the following languages and platforms, with others in the pipeline:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>.NET</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>.NET</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Native code</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Native code</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Java/Android</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Java/Android</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Node.js</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Node.js</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>PHP</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>PHP</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Ruby</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Ruby</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Python</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Python</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>PowerShell</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>PowerShell</linkText><title></title>
